result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason John Karels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason John Karels is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason John Karels was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Probation Agent to meet with Defendant in the jail.

- 18 days credit in the event of revocation.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $558.00. Payable through Probation.

Court costs of $268.00. Payable through Probation.
DNA Surcharge of $250.00.

- DNA Sample.
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections.
- Absolute Sobriety.
- No contact with Wal Mart.
- Random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: 08:17 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow, DF: Jason John Karels appeared from jail, pro se, Agent Moll appeared. Court reviews file. Court notes Atty. Satorius previously represented DE but understands public defender will not represent post-conviction. DOC is requesting imposed jail time. DE does not dispute and is requesting Huber privileges. State does not object to Huber. Court imposes 44 days jail, Huber authorized for purposes of employment. Agent Moll states that jail is retroactive to 4/22. Adjourned: 8:19 AM. kma

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF184 & 20CM368 (PLEAS):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Jason John Karels appeared from jail. Case called at 3:52 p.m. Court notes these matters are set for plea and sentencing. Atty Satorius recites agreement. State is in compliance with Victims Rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 22CF184. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possession of Methamphetamine in 22CF184. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct's 2, 3 & 4 in 22CF184. 20CM368 is dismissed and read in for restitution purposes.  Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to appeal. Court notes 18 days credit in the event of revocation. 

Crt orders:
In Ct. 1 in 22CF184:
- S/W 2 years probation. Agent to meet with DE in the jail. 

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections.

- Court costs of $268.00.

- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $250.00.

- Absolute Sobriety.

- No contact with Wal Mart.

- Restitution from 20CM368 in the amount of $558.00 payable to Wal Mart in New Richmond, WI.

- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

- Random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
Appointing Atty Satorius. km
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 5, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
